intro: Lotononis anthylloides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its compact rosette of velvety, dark green leaves and its showy, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of purple, blue, and white. The plant belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. The flowers are typically borne on short stems and are pollinated by small insects.
